alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 29 at 3:03AM EDT until July 29 at 4:45AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR EAST CENTRAL JOHNSON, MARTIN AND NORTH CENTRAL PIKE COUNTIES... At 303 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Inez, Warfield, Preece, Prince, Bradbury, McClure, Debord, Delong, Davella, Pevier, Andy, Lovely, Coalpoint, Moree, Pleasant, Davisport, Beauty, Pilgrim, Tomahawk and Laura. People are stuck in their houses and many buildings are experiencing inundation due to flood waters. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
